\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{index::doc}}


\sphinxAtStartPar
Welcome to the WriteBot API documentation. WriteBot is a handwriting synthesis application that generates realistic handwritten text using neural networks.

\sphinxstepscope


\chapter{Introduction}
\label{\detokenize{introduction:introduction}}\label{\detokenize{introduction::doc}}

\section{What is WriteBot?}
\label{\detokenize{introduction:what-is-writebot}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
WriteBot is a Flask\sphinxhyphen{}based web application that uses deep learning to generate realistic handwritten text. It leverages recurrent neural networks (RNNs) with attention mechanisms to synthesize handwriting from any input text.


\section{Features}
\label{\detokenize{introduction:features}}

\subsection{Handwriting Generation}
\label{\detokenize{introduction:handwriting-generation}}\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Single Generation}: Generate individual handwritten text in SVG format

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Batch Generation}: Process multiple texts from CSV files

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Multiple Styles}: Choose from various handwriting styles

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Character Overrides}: Replace AI\sphinxhyphen{}generated characters with custom hand\sphinxhyphen{}drawn variants

\end{itemize}


\subsection{User Management}
\label{\detokenize{introduction:user-management}}\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Authentication}: Secure login system with Flask\sphinxhyphen{}Login

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{User Roles}: Admin and regular user roles

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Activity Tracking}: Log all user actions

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Usage Statistics}: Track generation metrics

\end{itemize}


\subsection{Admin Dashboard}
\label{\detokenize{introduction:admin-dashboard}}\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{User Management}: Create, edit, and delete users

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Activity Monitoring}: View all user activities

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Statistics}: Analyze usage patterns

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Character Override Collections}: Manage custom character sets

\end{itemize}


\section{Architecture}
\label{\detokenize{introduction:architecture}}

\subsection{Technology Stack}
\label{\detokenize{introduction:technology-stack}}\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Backend}: Flask (Python)

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Database}: SQLAlchemy (SQLite/PostgreSQL)

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{ML Framework}: TensorFlow

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Frontend}: Vanilla JavaScript

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Authentication}: Flask\sphinxhyphen{}Login

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Documentation}: Sphinx

\end{itemize}


\subsection{Project Structure}
\label{\detokenize{introduction:project-structure}}
\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
WriteBot/
├── webapp/
│   ├── routes/          \PYGZsh{} API endpoints
│   ├── models.py        \PYGZsh{} Database models
│   ├── utils/           \PYGZsh{} Utility functions
│   ├── templates/       \PYGZsh{} Jinja2 templates
│   └── static/          \PYGZsh{} CSS, JS, assets
├── handwriting\PYGZus{}synthesis/  \PYGZsh{} ML models
├── docs/                \PYGZsh{} Sphinx documentation
└── app.py              \PYGZsh{} Main application
\end{sphinxVerbatim}


\section{Getting Started}
\label{\detokenize{introduction:getting-started}}

\subsection{Installation}
\label{\detokenize{introduction:installation}}\begin{enumerate}
\sphinxsetlistlabels{\arabic}{enumi}{enumii}{}{.}%
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Clone the repository

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Install dependencies: \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{pip install \sphinxhyphen{}r requirements.txt}}

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Initialize the database: \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{python \sphinxhyphen{}m webapp.init\_db}}

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Run the application: \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{python \sphinxhyphen{}m webapp.app}}

\end{enumerate}


\subsection{Configuration}
\label{\detokenize{introduction:configuration}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Set the following environment variables:
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{SECRET\_KEY}}: Flask secret key for sessions

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{DATABASE\_URL}}: Database connection string

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{FLASK\_ENV}}: Set to \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{development}} or \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{production}}

\end{itemize}


\subsection{API Authentication}
\label{\detokenize{introduction:api-authentication}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
All API endpoints (except health check) require authentication. Use the login endpoint to obtain a session:

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
curl\PYG{+w}{ }\PYGZhy{}X\PYG{+w}{ }POST\PYG{+w}{ }http://localhost:5000/auth/login\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{l+s+se}{\PYGZbs{}\PYGZbs{}}
\PYG{+w}{     }\PYGZhy{}H\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}Content\PYGZhy{}Type: application/x\PYGZhy{}www\PYGZhy{}form\PYGZhy{}urlencoded\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{l+s+se}{\PYGZbs{}\PYGZbs{}}
\PYG{+w}{     }\PYGZhy{}d\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}username=your\PYGZus{}username\PYGZam{}password=your\PYGZus{}password\PYGZdq{}}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\sphinxstepscope


\chapter{API Reference}
\label{\detokenize{api/index:api-reference}}\label{\detokenize{api/index::doc}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
This section provides detailed documentation for all WriteBot API endpoints.

\sphinxstepscope


\section{Authentication}
\label{\detokenize{api/authentication:authentication}}\label{\detokenize{api/authentication::doc}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
The authentication system uses Flask\sphinxhyphen{}Login for session management. Users must log in to access protected endpoints.


\subsection{Login}
\label{\detokenize{api/authentication:login}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{api/authentication:post--auth-login}}
\pysigstartsignatures
\pysigline
{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{POST~}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{/auth/login}}}
\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
Authenticate a user and create a session.

\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Example Request:}

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{n+nf}{POST} \PYG{n+nn}{/auth/login} \PYG{k+kr}{HTTP}\PYG{o}{/}\PYG{l+m}{1.1}
\PYG{n+na}{Host}\PYG{o}{:} \PYG{l}{localhost:5000}
\PYG{n+na}{Content\PYGZhy{}Type}\PYG{o}{:} \PYG{l}{application/x\PYGZhy{}www\PYGZhy{}form\PYGZhy{}urlencoded}

\PYG{n+nt}{username}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+s}{johndoe}\PYG{p}{\PYGZam{}}\PYG{n+nt}{password}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+s}{secretpass}\PYG{p}{\PYGZam{}}\PYG{n+nt}{remember}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+s}{on}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Form Parameters:}
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{username}} (string, required) \sphinxhyphen{} The username

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{password}} (string, required) \sphinxhyphen{} The password

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{remember}} (boolean, optional) \sphinxhyphen{} Remember me checkbox

\end{itemize}

\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Example Response:}

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{k+kr}{HTTP}\PYG{o}{/}\PYG{l+m}{1.1} \PYG{l+m}{302} \PYG{n+ne}{FOUND}
\PYG{n+na}{Location}\PYG{o}{:} \PYG{l}{/}
\PYG{n+na}{Set\PYGZhy{}Cookie}\PYG{o}{:} \PYG{l}{session=...; HttpOnly}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Status Codes:}
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{302 Found}} \sphinxhyphen{} Login successful, redirects to home

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{200 OK}} \sphinxhyphen{} Login failed, returns login page with error

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{400 Bad Request}} \sphinxhyphen{} Missing required parameters

\end{itemize}

\end{fulllineitems}

\sphinxAtStartPar

\end{itemize}

\end{fulllineitems}



\subsection{Session Management}
\label{\detokenize{api/authentication:session-management}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Sessions are managed automatically by Flask\sphinxhyphen{}Login. The session cookie is:
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{HttpOnly}: Cannot be accessed via JavaScript

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Secure}: Only transmitted over HTTPS in production

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{SameSite}: Set to \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Lax}} for CSRF protection

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Duration}: 30 days if “Remember Me” is checked

\end{itemize}


\subsection{Checking Authentication Status}
\label{\detokenize{api/authentication:checking-authentication-status}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
To check if a user is authenticated, you can access any protected endpoint. If the session is invalid or expired, you’ll receive a \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{401 Unauthorized}} response or be redirected to the login page.

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} Example: Check authentication}
\PYG{k+kn}{import}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{n+nn}{requests}

\PYG{n}{session} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{requests}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{Session}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{p}{)}

\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} Login}
\PYG{n}{response} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{session}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{post}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s+s1}{http://localhost:5000/auth/login}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{data}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{p}{\PYGZob{}}
    \PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s+s1}{username}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{p}{:} \PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s+s1}{johndoe}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{p}{,}
    \PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s+s1}{password}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{p}{:} \PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s+s1}{secretpass}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}
\PYG{p}{\PYGZcb{}}\PYG{p}{)}

\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} Now authenticated, can access protected endpoints}
\PYG{n}{health} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{session}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{get}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s+s1}{http://localhost:5000/api/health}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{p}{)}
\PYG{n+nb}{print}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{health}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{json}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{)}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\sphinxstepscope


\section{Generation}
\label{\detokenize{api/generation:generation}}\label{\detokenize{api/generation::doc}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Generate handwritten text from input strings. The API supports both single and batch generation.


\subsection{Generate SVG}
\label{\detokenize{api/generation:generate-svg}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{api/generation:post--api-v1-generate-svg}}
\pysigstartsignatures
\pysigline
{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{POST~}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{/api/v1/generate/svg}}}
\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
Generate handwritten text and return as SVG.

\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Example Request:}

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{n+nf}{POST} \PYG{n+nn}{/api/v1/generate/svg} \PYG{k+kr}{HTTP}\PYG{o}{/}\PYG{l+m}{1.1}

\PYG{n+na}{Cookie}\PYG{o}{:} \PYG{l}{session=...}

\PYG{p}{\PYGZob{}}
\PYG{+w}{    }\PYG{n+nt}{\PYGZdq{}text\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{:}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}Hello, World!\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{,}
\PYG{+w}{    }\PYG{n+nt}{\PYGZdq{}style\PYGZus{}id\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{:}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{l+m+mi}{1}\PYG{p}{,}
\PYG{+w}{    }\PYG{n+nt}{\PYGZdq{}bias\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{:}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{l+m+mf}{0.75}\PYG{p}{,}
\PYG{+w}{    }\PYG{n+nt}{\PYGZdq{}color\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{:}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}\PYGZsh{}000000\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{,}
\PYG{+w}{    }\PYG{n+nt}{\PYGZdq{}line\PYGZus{}height\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{:}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{l+m+mi}{60}\PYG{p}{,}
\PYG{+w}{    }\PYG{n+nt}{\PYGZdq{}view\PYGZus{}width\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{:}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{l+m+mi}{800}\PYG{p}{,}
\PYG{+w}{    }\PYG{n+nt}{\PYGZdq{}view\PYGZus{}height\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{:}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{l+m+mi}{600}\PYG{p}{,}
\PYG{+w}{    }\PYG{n+nt}{\PYGZdq{}character\PYGZus{}override\PYGZus{}collection\PYGZus{}id\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{:}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{k+kc}{null}
\PYG{p}{\PYGZcb{}}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{JSON Parameters:}
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{text}} (string, required) \sphinxhyphen{} The text to generate

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{style\_id}} (integer, optional) \sphinxhyphen{} Handwriting style ID (default: 1)

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{bias}} (float, optional) \sphinxhyphen{} Bias value 0.0\sphinxhyphen{}1.0 (default: 0.75)

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{color}} (string, optional) \sphinxhyphen{} Stroke color hex code (default: “\#000000”)

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{line\_height}} (integer, optional) \sphinxhyphen{} Line height in pixels (default: 60)

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{view\_width}} (integer, optional) \sphinxhyphen{} SVG viewport width (default: 800)

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{view\_height}} (integer, optional) \sphinxhyphen{} SVG viewport height (default: 600)

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{character\_override\_collection\_id}} (integer, optional) \sphinxhyphen{} Character override collection ID

\end{itemize}

\PYG{p}{\PYGZob{}}
\PYG{+w}{    }\PYG{n+nt}{\PYGZdq{}svg\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{:}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}\PYGZlt{}svg xmlns=\PYGZbs{}\PYGZdq{}http://www.w3.org/2000/svg\PYGZbs{}\PYGZdq{}...\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{,}

\subsection{Parameter Details}
\label{\detokenize{api/generation:parameter-details}}

\subsubsection{Bias Parameter}
\label{\detokenize{api/generation:bias-parameter}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
The \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{bias}} parameter controls the randomness of the generated handwriting:
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{0.0}} \sphinxhyphen{} Most random, less like training data

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{0.5}} \sphinxhyphen{} Balanced randomness

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{0.75}} \sphinxhyphen{} Recommended default

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{1.0}} \sphinxhyphen{} Least random, most like training data

\end{itemize}

\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Recommendation}: Use values between 0.7 and 0.9 for best results.


\subsubsection{Color Parameter}
\label{\detokenize{api/generation:color-parameter}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
The \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{color}} parameter accepts:
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Hex codes: \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{\#000000}}, \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{\#FF5733}}

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Named colors: \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{black}}, \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{blue}}, \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{red}}

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
RGB: \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{rgb(255, 0, 0)}}

\end{itemize}


\subsubsection{Line Height}
\label{\detokenize{api/generation:line-height}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
The \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{line\_height}} parameter determines:
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Vertical spacing between lines

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Recommended: 50\sphinxhyphen{}80 pixels

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Smaller values create tighter line spacing

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Larger values create looser line spacing

\end{itemize}


\subsubsection{Character Overrides}
\label{\detokenize{api/generation:character-overrides}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
When \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{character\_override\_collection\_id}} is provided:
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
AI\sphinxhyphen{}generated characters are replaced with custom hand\sphinxhyphen{}drawn variants

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
The system randomly selects from available variants for each character

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Only characters with overrides are replaced

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Other characters use AI generation

\end{itemize}


\subsection{Error Handling}
\label{\detokenize{api/generation:error-handling}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Empty Text Error:}

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{p}{\PYGZob{}}
\PYG{+w}{    }\PYG{n+nt}{\PYGZdq{}error\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{:}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}Text parameter is required and cannot be empty\PYGZdq{}}
\PYG{p}{\PYGZcb{}}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Invalid Style Error:}

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{p}{\PYGZob{}}
\PYG{+w}{    }\PYG{n+nt}{\PYGZdq{}error\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{:}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}Invalid style\PYGZus{}id. Available styles: 1\PYGZhy{}10\PYGZdq{}}
\PYG{p}{\PYGZcb{}}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Generation Error:}

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{p}{\PYGZob{}}
\PYG{+w}{    }\PYG{n+nt}{\PYGZdq{}error\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{:}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}Failed to generate handwriting\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{,}
\PYG{+w}{    }\PYG{n+nt}{\PYGZdq{}details\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{:}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}Model error: ...\PYGZdq{}}
\PYG{p}{\PYGZcb{}}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\sphinxstepscope


\section{Batch Generation}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{api/batch:post--api-batch}}
\pysigstartsignatures
\pysigline
{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{POST~}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{/api/batch}}}
\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar

\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Example Request:}

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]

\PYG{n+na}{Host}\PYG{o}{:} \PYG{l}{localhost:5000}
\PYG{n+na}{Content\PYGZhy{}Type}\PYG{o}{:} \PYG{l}{multipart/form\PYGZhy{}data}
\PYG{n+na}{Cookie}\PYG{o}{:} \PYG{l}{session=...}

\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}boundary
Content\PYGZhy{}Disposition: form\PYGZhy{}data; name=\PYGZdq{}csv\PYGZus{}file\PYGZdq{}; filename=\PYGZdq{}data.csv\PYGZdq{}
Content\PYGZhy{}Type: text/csv

text,style\PYGZus{}id,bias
\PYGZdq{}Hello World\PYGZdq{},1,0.75
\PYGZdq{}Test generation\PYGZdq{},2,0.8
\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}boundary\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Form Parameters:}
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{output\_format}} (string, optional) \sphinxhyphen{} “svg” or “png”

\end{itemize}

\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{CSV Format:}

\sphinxAtStartPar

\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{style\_id}} (optional) \sphinxhyphen{} Style ID, defaults to 1

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{bias}} (optional) \sphinxhyphen{} Bias value, defaults to 0.75

\end{itemize}

\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Example Response:}

\PYG{n+na}{Content\PYGZhy{}Type}\PYG{o}{:} \PYG{l}{application/zip}
\PYG{n+na}{Content\PYGZhy{}Disposition}\PYG{o}{:} \PYG{l}{attachment; filename=\PYGZdq{}batch\PYGZus{}results.zip\PYGZdq{}}

[Binary ZIP content]
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar

\end{itemize}

\subsection{Get Individual Batch File}
\label{\detokenize{api/batch:get-individual-batch-file}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{api/batch:get--api-batch-result-(job_id)-file-(filename)}}
\pysigstartsignatures
\pysiglinewithargsret
{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{GET~}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{/api/batch/result/}}}
{\sphinxparam{job\_id}}
{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{/file/}}}
{\sphinxparam{filename}}
{}
\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
Retrieve a single generated file from a batch job for preview purposes.

\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Parameters:}
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{job\_id}} (string) \sphinxhyphen{} The batch job ID

\item {}

\section{Character Overrides}

\subsection{Usage in Generation}
\label{\detokenize{api/character_overrides:usage-in-generation}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
To use character overrides in generation:

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{p}{\PYGZob{}}
\PYG{+w}{    }\PYG{n+nt}{\PYGZdq{}text\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{:}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}Hello World\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{,}
\PYG{+w}{    }\PYG{n+nt}{\PYGZdq{}style\PYGZus{}id\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{:}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{l+m+mi}{1}\PYG{p}{,}
\PYG{+w}{    }\PYG{n+nt}{\PYGZdq{}character\PYGZus{}override\PYGZus{}collection\PYGZus{}id\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{:}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{l+m+mi}{1}
\PYG{p}{\PYGZcb{}}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\sphinxAtStartPar
When a collection is specified:
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
The system looks for overrides for each character

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
If multiple variants exist, one is randomly selected

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Characters without overrides use AI generation

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
This creates natural variation in the output

\end{itemize}


\section{API Overview}
\label{\detokenize{api/index:api-overview}}

\subsection{Base URL}
\label{\detokenize{api/index:base-url}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
All API endpoints are relative to the base URL:
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Development: \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{http://localhost:5000}}

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Production: \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{https://your\sphinxhyphen{}domain.com}}

\end{itemize}


\subsection{Authentication}
\label{\detokenize{api/index:authentication}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Most endpoints require authentication via Flask\sphinxhyphen{}Login session cookies. After logging in, the session cookie is automatically included in subsequent requests.


\subsection{Response Format}
\label{\detokenize{api/index:response-format}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
All API responses are in JSON format with the following structure:

\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Success Response:}

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{p}{\PYGZob{}}
\PYG{+w}{    }\PYG{n+nt}{\PYGZdq{}status\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{:}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}success\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{,}
\PYG{+w}{    }\PYG{n+nt}{\PYGZdq{}data\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{:}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{p}{\PYGZob{}}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{err}{.}\PYG{err}{.}\PYG{err}{.}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{p}{\PYGZcb{},}
\PYG{+w}{    }\PYG{n+nt}{\PYGZdq{}message\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{:}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}Operation completed successfully\PYGZdq{}}
\PYG{p}{\PYGZcb{}}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Error Response:}

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{p}{\PYGZob{}}
\PYG{+w}{    }\PYG{n+nt}{\PYGZdq{}error\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{:}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}Error message\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{,}
\PYG{+w}{    }\PYG{n+nt}{\PYGZdq{}details\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{:}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}Additional error details\PYGZdq{}}
\PYG{p}{\PYGZcb{}}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}


\subsection{HTTP Status Codes}
\label{\detokenize{api/index:http-status-codes}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
The API uses standard HTTP status codes:
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{200 OK}}: Request successful

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{201 Created}}: Resource created successfully

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{400 Bad Request}}: Invalid request parameters

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{401 Unauthorized}}: Authentication required

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{403 Forbidden}}: Insufficient permissions

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{404 Not Found}}: Resource not found

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{500 Internal Server Error}}: Server error

\end{itemize}


\subsection{Rate Limiting}
\label{\detokenize{api/index:rate-limiting}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Currently, there are no rate limits. However, it’s recommended to:
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Limit concurrent requests to 5 per session

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Use batch endpoints for multiple generations

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Implement exponential backoff for retries

\end{itemize}


\subsection{Common Headers}
\label{\detokenize{api/index:common-headers}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Request Headers:}

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]

\chapter{Database Models}
\label{\detokenize{models:database-models}}\label{\detokenize{models::doc}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
WriteBot uses SQLAlchemy for database management. All models are defined in \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{webapp/models.py}}.
\index{module@\spxentry{module}!webapp.models@\spxentry{webapp.models}}\index{webapp.models@\spxentry{webapp.models}!module@\spxentry{module}}

\section{Migrations}
\label{\detokenize{models:migrations}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Database migrations are handled using SQLAlchemy’s \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{create\_all()}} method. To initialize the database:

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{k+kn}{from}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{n+nn}{webapp}\PYG{n+nn}{.}\PYG{n+nn}{app}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{k+kn}{import} \PYG{n}{app}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{db}
\PYG{k}{with} \PYG{n}{app}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{app\PYGZus{}context}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}
    \PYG{n}{db}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{create\PYGZus{}all}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{p}{)}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\sphinxAtStartPar
Or run the initialization script:

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
python\PYG{+w}{ }\PYGZhy{}m\PYG{+w}{ }webapp.init\PYGZus{}db
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\sphinxstepscope

\section{Authentication Utilities}
\label{\detokenize{utilities:module-webapp.utils.auth_utils}}\label{\detokenize{utilities:authentication-utilities}}\index{module@\spxentry{module}!webapp.utils.auth\_utils@\spxentry{webapp.utils.auth\_utils}}\index{webapp.utils.auth\_utils@\spxentry{webapp.utils.auth\_utils}!module@\spxentry{module}}\index{admin\_required() (in module webapp.utils.auth\_utils)@\spxentry{admin\_required()}\spxextra{in module webapp.utils.auth\_utils}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{utilities:webapp.utils.auth_utils.admin_required}}
\pysigstartsignatures
\pysiglinewithargsret
{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{webapp.utils.auth\_utils.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{admin\_required}}}
{\sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{f}}}
{}
\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
Decorator to require admin role for a route.
Use this in addition to @login\_required.

\sphinxAtStartPar
Decorator to require admin role for a route.

\sphinxAtStartPar
Usage:

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{n+nd}{@app}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{route}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s+s1}{/admin/dashboard}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{p}{)}
\PYG{n+nd}{@login\PYGZus{}required}
\PYG{n+nd}{@admin\PYGZus{}required}
\PYG{k}{def}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{n+nf}{admin\PYGZus{}dashboard}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}
    \PYG{k}{return} \PYG{n}{render\PYGZus{}template}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s+s1}{admin/dashboard.html}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{p}{)}

    \PYG{n}{metadata}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{p}{\PYGZob{}}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s+s1}{text\PYGZus{}length}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{p}{:} \PYG{n+nb}{len}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{text}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s+s1}{style\PYGZus{}id}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{p}{:} \PYG{n}{style\PYGZus{}id}\PYG{p}{\PYGZcb{}}
\PYG{p}{)}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\section{Custom Decorators}
\label{\detokenize{utilities:custom-decorators}}

\subsection{Admin Required}
\label{\detokenize{utilities:admin-required}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
The \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{@admin\_required}} decorator checks if the current user has admin privileges:

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{k+kn}{from}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{n+nn}{functools}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{k+kn}{import} \PYG{n}{wraps}
\PYG{k+kn}{from}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{n+nn}{flask\PYGZus{}login}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{k+kn}{import} \PYG{n}{current\PYGZus{}user}
\PYG{k+kn}{from}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{n+nn}{flask}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{k+kn}{import} \PYG{n}{abort}

\PYG{k}{def}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{n+nf}{admin\PYGZus{}required}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{f}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}
    \PYG{n+nd}{@wraps}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{f}\PYG{p}{)}
    \PYG{k}{def}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{n+nf}{decorated\PYGZus{}function}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{o}{*}\PYG{n}{args}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{o}{*}\PYG{o}{*}\PYG{n}{kwargs}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}
        \PYG{k}{if} \PYG{o+ow}{not} \PYG{n}{current\PYGZus{}user}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{is\PYGZus{}authenticated}\PYG{p}{:}
            \PYG{n}{abort}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{l+m+mi}{401}\PYG{p}{)}
        \PYG{k}{if} \PYG{o+ow}{not} \PYG{n}{current\PYGZus{}user}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{is\PYGZus{}admin}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}
            \PYG{n}{abort}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{l+m+mi}{403}\PYG{p}{)}
        \PYG{k}{return} \PYG{n}{f}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{o}{*}\PYG{n}{args}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{o}{*}\PYG{o}{*}\PYG{n}{kwargs}\PYG{p}{)}
    \PYG{k}{return} \PYG{n}{decorated\PYGZus{}function}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}


\subsection{Rate Limiting}
\label{\detokenize{utilities:rate-limiting}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
While not currently implemented, rate limiting can be added using decorators:

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{k+kn}{from}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{n+nn}{flask\PYGZus{}limiter}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{k+kn}{import} \PYG{n}{Limiter}
\PYG{k+kn}{from}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{n+nn}{flask\PYGZus{}limiter}\PYG{n+nn}{.}\PYG{n+nn}{util}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{k+kn}{import} \PYG{n}{get\PYGZus{}remote\PYGZus{}address}

\PYG{n}{limiter} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{Limiter}\PYG{p}{(}
    \PYG{n}{app}\PYG{p}{,}
    \PYG{n}{key\PYGZus{}func}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{n}{get\PYGZus{}remote\PYGZus{}address}\PYG{p}{,}
    \PYG{n}{default\PYGZus{}limits}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{p}{[}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{200 per day}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{50 per hour}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{]}
\PYG{p}{)}

\PYG{n+nd}{@app}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{route}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{/api/generate}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{)}
\PYG{n+nd}{@limiter}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{limit}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{10 per minute}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{)}
\PYG{k}{def}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{n+nf}{generate}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}
    \PYG{k}{pass}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}


\chapter{Overview}
\label{\detokenize{index:overview}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
WriteBot provides a comprehensive REST API for generating handwritten text in SVG format. The API supports:
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Single text generation

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Batch generation with CSV import

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Multiple handwriting styles

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Character overrides for custom variants

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
User authentication and authorization

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Admin dashboard for user management

\end{itemize}


\chapter{Quick Start}
\label{\detokenize{index:quick-start}}\begin{enumerate}
\sphinxsetlistlabels{\arabic}{enumi}{enumii}{}{.}%
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Authentication}: Log in to get access to the API

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Generate}: Use the generation endpoints to create handwritten text

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Batch Processing}: Upload CSV files for bulk generation

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Styles}: Choose from multiple handwriting styles

\end{enumerate}
